input: user: Compose a sonnet about the beauty of a rose.
output:
Fair Rose that dost thy blushes in the sun bestow, A garden's pride by lovers with thine honor crowned; Thy fragrance sweet doth win the heart unsoiled as thou The very first glimpse casteth in Eden's bourn.
Thou hast a stem of gold unto the touch so frail To kiss which doth each lover in their bliss enthrall; And every flower that doth thy name dost wear In service to thee, for thine beauty scarce can fare.
Thus in thy bloom dost thou outshine all earthly blooms, With petals as fair as love's first sweetest roons. May I but tend unto thee with care and trust Thine grace will ne'er cease while I thus under thee doth drest.
complianceText:
